==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=n|rs=艸11}}

# [[lotus]] [[plant]] or [[flower]], ''[[Nelumbo nucifera]]''

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[れん]] (ren)
|kanon=[[れん]] (ren)
|kun=[[はす]] (hasu), [[はちす]] (hachisu)
}}

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|ハス|蓮}}
{{wikipedia|Nelumbo nucifera}}
[[File:Mukuge.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|蓮}} (''hachisu''): '''''[[Hibiscus syriacus]]''''': the '''[[rose of Sharon]]''', '''{{vern|rose mallow}}''', or '''{{vern|St. Joseph's rod}}'''.]]
[[File:Sacred_lotus_Nelumbo_nucifera.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|蓮}} (''hachisu'', ''hasu'', ''ren''): '''''[[Nelumbo nucifera]]''''': the '''[[lotus]] [[flower]] and [[plant]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|はちす}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=はちす|蜂|tr1=hachi|t1=bee|巣|tr2=su|t2=nest, hive}}, literally “[[beehive]], [[honeycomb]]”, from the way the [[lotus]] [[seed]] resembles a [[honeycomb]].<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|はちす|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はちす}}

# older name for ''hasu'' below: a [[lotus]] [[plant]] or [[flower]], ''[[Nelumbo nucifera]]''
# {{lb|ja|sort=はちす|Buddhism|particularly {{w|Pure Land Buddhism}}}} a [[lotus]] [[bloom]] in the realm of [[Sukhāvatī]] (“Land of Ultimate Bliss”), as an expression of [[reincarnation]]
# alternate name for {{m|ja|木槿|tr=mukuge}}, ''[[Hibiscus syriacus]]'': the [[rose of Sharon]], {{vern|rose mallow}}, or {{vern|St. Joseph's rod}}

=====Related terms=====
{{rel-top}}
* {{ja-r|蜂巣|はちす}}: a [[beehive]]; a [[honeycomb]]
{{rel-bottom}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|はちす}}

# {{non-gloss definition|the name of various places in Japan}}
# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=はちす|A=a|nodot=1}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|はす}}
{{IPAchar|/hat͡ɕisu/}} → *{{IPAchar|/hassu/}} → {{IPAchar|/hasu/}}

Appears to be a contraction of ''hachisu'' above.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|はす|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はす}}

# a [[lotus]] [[plant]] or [[flower]]

=====Usage notes=====
The reading ''hasu'' appears to be more common for the {{m|en|lotus}} meaning in modern Japanese.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|蓮根|はすね}}: a [[lotus]] [[root]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|はす}}

# {{given name|lang=ja|sort=はす|female|A=a}}
# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=はす|A=a|nodot=1}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|れん}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=れん}} {{m|zh|蓮|tr=len||lotus fruit}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''lián''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|れん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|れん}}

# a [[lotus]] [[plant]] or [[flower]]

=====Usage notes=====
The ''ren'' reading is seldom used on its own. It is most often used in compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|蓮華|れんげ}}: a [[lotus]] [[bloom]], a lotus [[flower]]
* {{ja-r|蓮根|れんこん}}: a [[lotus]] [[root]]
* {{ja-r|蓮台|れんだい}}: a [[lotus]] [[blossom]] used as a [[seat]] or [[dais]] for a [[buddha]] or [[bodhisattva]]
* {{ja-r|睡蓮|すいれん}}: a [[water lily]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|れん}}

# {{given name|lang=ja|sort=れん|female|A=a}}
# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=れん|A=a|nodot=1}}
